Data.Name: Tiny (512m diameter)
Data.Tooltip: This map size has barely any room for even the most basic resources.

Data.Name: Small (768m diameter)
Data.Tooltip: Small maps are suitable for 1v1 matches, as players can reach the enemy quickly while still having some room to expand.

Data.Name: Smedium (1km diameter)
Data.Tooltip: This map size provides plenty of space for two players, but even eight players fit.

Data.Name: Medium (1.25km diameter)
Data.Tooltip: This is the ideal mapsize for 4 to 8 players, because there is plenty of space to expand while the neighbors are quickly reachable.

Data.Name: Extra Medium (1.5km diameter)
Data.Tooltip: The Extra Medium mapsize is recommended when great portions of the map are covered with water or inaccessible mountains.

Data.Name: Large (1.75km diameter)
Data.Tooltip: The Large mapsize is recommended when great portions of the map are covered with water or inaccessible mountains.

Data.Name: Extra Large (2km diameter)
Data.Tooltip: Extra Large mapsize is recommended when great portions of the map are covered with water or inaccessible mountains.

Data.Name: Giant (2.4km diameter)
Data.Tooltip: Giant maps are not recommended as it takes very long to reach the enemy and the game performance can be reduced.

Data.Name: Humongous (3.6km diameter)
Data.Tooltip: Humongous maps are not recommended as it takes very long to reach the enemy and the game performance can be reduced. Only for good computers.
